page.title: 02FARMING AROUND BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: My name is Keith. I live on a 100 acre farm near Barnoldswick. My farm is typical of the farms in this area. The land is mainly pasture and meadow for cows but we keep some sheep on the rougher grazing. Our stone built farmhouse is about 100 years old but many in the area are much older. Our outbuildings include: cubicles, silo, milking parlour, calf shed, hen hut and garage. Most farmers in this area concentrate on milk production from herds of friesian cows,although one or two do keep a few beef cattle. Farm-bottled milk is quite common with many farmers having their own milk rounds.Any surplus milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. On the poorer grassland some farmers keep flocks of sheep.
